debugging_methodology_protocol.when: User reports error with stack trace, or previous fix attempts failed
debugging_methodology_protocol.step_1_analyze_not_fix: PAUSE - Do NOT modify code yet. Ask: 'What assumptions could cause this? What conditions must be true?'
debugging_methodology_protocol.step_2_identify_root_causes: Walk through AT LEAST 2 possible causes based on stack trace and common misuse patterns
debugging_methodology_protocol.step_3_validate_hypothesis: Propose fix with specific test steps to validate (e.g., 'Add console.log(context) before failing line')
debugging_methodology_protocol.step_4_avoid_repeats: Never repeat previous failed attempts. Ask clarifying questions if uncertain.
debugging_methodology_protocol.enforcement: Claude checks root cause BEFORE proposing fix

filter_logic_best_practices_2025_10_30.incident: QWEN created Op.or filter conflict: search and subscription filters overwrote each other instead of combining
filter_logic_best_practices_2025_10_30.root_cause: Sequelize pattern: Assignment to where[Op.or] twice = second overwrites first
filter_logic_best_practices_2025_10_30.lesson_for_all_ais: When building MULTIPLE filter conditions in ORM queries, understand whether filters should be COMBINED or SEPARATE

solution_pattern.problem: âŒ Multiple assignments to same operator key overwrites previous value
solution_pattern.code_example_wrong: if (search) { where[Op.or] = [...search conditions]; } if (subscription) { where[Op.or] = [...subscription conditions]; } // Second overwrites first!
solution_pattern.solution_approach: âœ… Create conditions array and push each filter condition, then combine with Op.and at the end
solution_pattern.code_example_correct: const conditions = []; if (search) { conditions.push({ [Op.or]: [...] }); } if (subscription) { conditions.push({ [Op.or]: [...] }); } if (conditions.length > 0) { where[Op.and] = conditions; }
solution_pattern.semantic_rule: Op.and wraps multiple filter objects. Op.or applies WITHIN a single condition. Combining filters = Op.and(filter1, filter2, filter3)

prevention: When combining multiple independent filters (search + subscription + status + etc): use conditions[] pattern
Each filter gets its own [Op.or] for internal options, but filters combine via [Op.and]
BEFORE implementing: Sketch the filter logic: (search_term OR search_email) AND (subscription_free OR subscription_expired) AND ...
TEST: Verify filters work INDEPENDENTLY and COMBINED. Don't test only one at a time.
VALIDATE: Check git diff to see actual SQL pattern - should see Op.and wrapping Op.or conditions
filter_logic_best_practices_2025_10_30.applicability: Sequelize ORM, other ORMs with similar pattern logic
